Original hand pumpers discharged their water through a small pipe or monitor attached to the top of the pump tub. It was not until the late 1860s that hoses became widely available to convey water more easily from the hand pumps, and later steam pumpers, to the fire.", "snippetAttribution": {"license": {"name": "CC-BY-SA", "url": "http:\/\/creativecommons.org\/licenses\/by-sa\/3.0\/"}, "licenseNotice": "Text under CC-BY-SA license"}, "deepLinks": [{"name": "History", "url": "https:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Fire_hose#History", "snippet": "Until the mid-19th century, most fires were fought by water transported to the scene in buckets. Original hand pumpers discharged their water through a small pipe or monitor attached to the top of the pump tub. It was not until the late 1860s that hoses became widely available to convey water more easily from the hand pumps, and later steam pumpers, to the fire. In Amsterdam in the Dutch Republic, the Superintendent of the Fire Brigade, Jan van der Heyden, and his son Nicholaas took firefighting"}, {"name": "Modern usage", "url": "https:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Fire_hose#Modern_usage", "snippet": "Modern fire hoses use a variety of natural and synthetic fabrics and elastomers in their construction. These materials allow the hoses to be stored wet without rotting and to resist the damaging effects of exposure to sunlight and chemicals. Modern hoses are also lighter weight than older designs, and this has helped reduce the physical strain on firefighters. Various devices are becoming more prevalent that remove the air from the interior of fire hose, commonly referred to as fire hose vacuums"}, {"name": "Manufacturing process", "url": "https:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Fire_hose#Manufacturing_process", "snippet": "Fire hose is usually manufactured in a plant that specializes in providing hose products to municipal, industrial, and forestry fire departments. Here is a typical sequence of operations used to manufacture a double jacket, rubber-lined fire hose. Preparing the yarn"}, {"name": "Connections", "url": "https:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Fire_hose#Connections", "snippet": "Hose connections are often made from brass, though hardened aluminum connections are also specified. In countries which use quick-action couplers for attack hoses, forged aluminum has been used for decades because the weight penalty of brass for Storz couplers is higher than for threaded connections. Threaded hose couplings are used in the United States and Canada. Each of these countries uses a different kind of threading. Many other countries have standardized on quick-action couplings, which"}], "dateLastCrawled": "2018-04-03T17:04:00.0000000Z", "language": "en"}, {"id": "https:\/\/api.cognitive.microsoft.com\/api\/v7\/#WebPages.1", "name": "Fire engine - Wikipedia", "url": "https:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Pumper_truck", "about": [{"name": "Fire engine"}], "isFamilyFriendly": true, "displayUrl": "https:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Pumper_truck", "snippet": "Some fire engines have a fixed deluge gun, also known as a master stream, which directs a heavy stream of water to wherever the operator points it.An additional feature of engines are their preconnected hose lines, commonly referred to as preconnects. The preconnects are attached to the engine's onboard water supply and allow firefighters to quickly mount an aggressive attack on the fire as ...", "snippetAttribution": {"license": {"name": "CC-BY-SA", "url": "http:\/\/creativecommons.org\/licenses\/by-sa\/3.0\/"}, "licenseNotice": "Text under CC-BY-SA license"}, "dateLastCrawled": "2018-04-05T08:20:00.0000000Z", "language": "en"}, {"id": "https:\/\/api.cognitive.microsoft.com\/api\/v7\/#WebPages.2", "name": "Fire fighting: A simple introduction for kids - Explain ...", "url": "http:\/\/www.explainthatstuff.com\/firefighting.html", "isFamilyFriendly": true, "displayUrl": "www.explainthatstuff.com\/firefighting.html", "snippet": "Rescue Vehicles. Firefighters don't just put out fires. Most fire departments have dedicated rescue trucks designed for tackling automobile accidents, which carry hydraulic jacks and airbags for lifting overturned vehicles, a punch for breaking windscreens, and high-temperature gas torches that can cut people free from crashed cars. One new tool is a steering-wheel cover to stop a car's airbag ...", "dateLastCrawled": "2018-04-05T13:32:00.0000000Z", "language": "en"}, {"id": "https:\/\/api.cognitive.microsoft.com\/api\/v7\/#WebPages.3", "name": "Avoiding Apparatus Seating Pitfalls - Fire Apparatus", "url": "http:\/\/www.fireapparatusmagazine.com\/articles\/print\/volume-19\/issue-3\/features\/avoiding-apparatus-seating-pitfalls.html", "isFamilyFriendly": true, "displayUrl": "www.fireapparatusmagazine.com\/articles\/print\/volume-19\/issue-3\/...", "snippet": "Department Demands. Make sure all of your hose loads have covers.. Open seating and standing areas such as shown here should not be occupied any time the vehicle is in motion. Too many times a vehicle like this falls in an unseen ditch, rolls over and", "dateLastCrawled": "2018-04-04T08:29:00.0000000Z", "language": "en"}, {"id": "https:\/\/api.cognitive.microsoft.com\/api\/v7\/#WebPages.5", "name": "Today's Urban Design Observation: What Exactly are These ...", "url": "http:\/\/www.core77.com\/posts\/74287\/Todays-Urban-Design-Observation-What-Exactly-are-These-Pieces-of-Street-Furniture-and-How-Do-They-Help-Firefighters", "isFamilyFriendly": true, "displayUrl": "www.core77.com\/posts\/74287\/Todays-Urban-Design-Observation-What...", "snippet": "When firefighters arrive on scene, they'll plug a hose from the pumper truck into the standpipe connection.
